qas.question: What was happening to Idris' government in the 1960s?

answers.text: Idris' government was increasingly unpopular by the latter 1960s

qas.question: What industry greatly impacted the downfall of Idris's government?
What sort of problems did the oil industry experience in Libya?

answers.text: corruption and entrenched systems of patronage were widespread throughout the oil industry

qas.question: What did the Libyan workers do to show their support of Egypt?

answers.text: Libyan workers shut down oil terminals in solidarity with Egypt

qas.question: Did the CIA confirm knowledge of Gaddafi's upcoming coup?:

answers.text: they have since claimed ignorance, stating that they were monitoring Abdul Aziz Shalhi's Black Boots revolutionary group.

qas.question: What country won the Six-Day War?
In what cities did protests against westerners flare up in 1967?
On what country's behalf were the 1967 protests taking place?
In what year did the CIA begin to expect a military coup in Libya?
What revolutionary organization was led by Abdul Aziz Shalhi?

context: <a0_0>Idris' government was increasingly unpopular by the latter 1960s<a0_0/>; it had exacerbated Libya's traditional regional and tribal divisions by centralising the country's federal system in order to take advantage of the country's oil wealth, while <a2_0>corruption and entrenched systems of patronage were widespread throughout <a1_0>the oil industry<a2_0/><a1_0/>. Arab nationalism was increasingly popular, and protests flared up following Egypt's 1967 defeat in the Six-Day War with <a5_0>Israel<a5_0/>; allied to the western powers, Idris' administration was seen as pro-Israeli. Anti-western riots broke out in <a6_0>Tripoli and Benghazi<a6_0/>, while <a3_0>Libyan workers shut down oil terminals in solidarity with <a7_0>Egypt<a7_0/><a3_0/>. By <a8_0>1969<a8_0/>, the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency was expecting segments of Libya's armed forces to launch a coup. Although claims have been made that they knew of Gaddafi's Free Officers Movement, <a4_0>they have since claimed ignorance, stating that they were monitoring Abdul Aziz Shalhi's <a9_0>Black Boots<a9_0/> revolutionary group.
